toc_entry.title: Taco Capital, U.S.A.
toc_entry.description: You want tacos with camitas or cactus pads? Beef barbecue or bacon and eggs? Come to San antonio, where tacos aren’t just an afterthought on a Tex-Mex menu-they’re a way of life.

toc_entry.title: The Great Texas Taco Tour
toc_entry.description: From El Paso’s ingenious taco trays to austin’s uplifting breakfast tacos, each Texas city celebrates this noble creation in its own way.

toc_entry.title: Swamp Gas
toc_entry.description: When Jimmy Lee, an unrepentant troublemaker, felt he had taken one insult too many from the powerful Fredeman family, he called in the law. The results of that action have exposed decades of larceny and corruption in Port arthur and threaten a Gulf Coast empire.

toc_entry.title: The Rig Count
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: At first, Hughes Tool used the count to plan its own future. Now an entire industry uses it to plan theirs.

toc_entry.title: Solace In the Desert
toc_entry.description: With dogged independence, amazing endurance, and a rugged romantic vision, photographer Laura Gilpin helped create the way we see the West today.

toc_entry.title: Eighteen Minutes
toc_entry.description: Unlike the alamo, which can seem as remote and mysterious as Stonehenge, the San Jacinto battlefield has few secrets. Its history lies close at hand.

toc_entry.title: Rodeo Madness
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: An interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Hot Springs Eternal
toc_entry.subtitle: Travel
toc_entry.description: Going to Hot Springs was once a Texas rite of passage steeped in the ways of old sin. Today this arkansas resort is still worth the trip.

toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: by Peter applebome Three unknown Texas writers tackle three different genres and prove the novel is alive and well.

toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
